result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn R. Ison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn R. Ison is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn R. Ison was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Shawn R. Ison was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant called and will be about a week late with payment

3:36 p.m. Defendant Shawn R Ison in court.  Calling 16tr380 and 15cm322. Court quashes warrant authorized but not issued. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance and non-payment. Defendant states he has a job now, waiting to get paid, wants $50 payment plan. Making payments in other counties. These are only 2 in Oneida County. Court approves $50 monthly payment. Payment application plan given. Adj. 3:39 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Review hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Prior: 9721 Blue Lake  Road, Minocqua, WI 54548

08:43 a.m. Defendant Shawn R. Ison in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig statement that victim rights legislation complied with. Michlig/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.

2:41 p.m. Defendant Shawn R. Ison in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett requests jury trial. Bail continued. Adj. 2:44 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:54 p.m. Defendant Shawn R. Ison in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Shawn R. Ison in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bennett/Schiek statement to bond. Bennett enters not guilty plea.  Court reinstates previous $1000 sig bond. Adj. 1:59 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
per Brandi @ ONSO - now in ONSO
per Mary - iN vilas on detainer-
12:31 P.M. Defendant Shawn R. Ison not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non-appearance, State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant.

1:35 p.m. Defendant Shawn R. Ison in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to counsel - Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel - Waiver free and voluntary. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court directs defendant to speak to DA's office. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-03-2015 01:15 pm

1:44 p.m. Defendant Shawn R. Ison in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
